column4: hello all...damn I screwed up; hope someone can help... I killed grub (it's a long story), and while trying to reinstall it I deleted my initrd and vmlinux in /boot
do you want copies of those files?
no
so what do you want?
oh..duh, I thought it said do I have copies
so it's as simple as that?
if all you've done is deleted those 2 files, then putting them back should sort you out
I thought the initrd was different for each computer, just a generic file?
it's a binary in the .deb file I think
well, it's worth a try, so you know where I can get them?
i might be wrong about that.  I can't find boot/initrd in any package.  sorry!
didn't think it was a package... :0
I didn't think of that though , let me google for it real quick
I guess what you need to do is download the linux-image-2.6.12-9-386.deb and initramfs-tools.deb packages from packages.ubuntu.com and then boot into 'rescue' mode and install them with dpkg -i
if you're lucky, the .deb files are already in your package cache, /var/cache/apt/archives/
and I would just run initramfs? after I install them?
I think that installing the kernel will make the initrd for you
aahhh
sounds like it might work...I'll give it a shot and check back; thanks
just wanted to let you know it worked
I just had to install the linux-image deb and it generated the initrd and ran grub automagically
there's a user guide?  where's that?
